title: [FR] Support for built-in SageMaker algorithms

labels.name: needs author feedback
labels.description: Issue is waiting for the author to respond

labels.name: area/scoring
labels.description: MLflow Model server, model deployment tools, Spark UDFs

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

labels.name: priority/backlog
labels.description: We believe it is useful, but donâ€™t see it being prioritized in the next few months.

body:
## Willingness to contribute
- [ ] Yes. I can contribute this feature independently.
- [x] Yes. I would be willing to contribute this feature with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute this feature at this time.

## Proposal Summary
Add native support for the built-in algorithms (training jobs) in SageMaker.

## Motivation
I work with an AWS partner and many of our ML projects use the built-in algorithms for quick iteration and creation of baseline models. On top of that, we use SageMaker to 

### What component(s), interfaces, languages, and integrations does this feature affect?
Components 
- [x] `area/artifacts`: Artifact stores and artifact logging
- [ ] `area/build`: Build and test infrastructure for MLflow
- [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages
- [ ] `area/examples`: Example code
- [ ] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for
Model Registry
- [x] `area/models`: MLmodel format, model serialization/deserialization, flavors
- [ ] `area/projects`: MLproject format, project running backends
- [x] `area/scoring`: Local serving, model deployment tools, spark UDFs
- [x] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging

Integrations
- [ ] `integrations/azure`: Azure and Azure ML integrations
- [x] `integrations/sagemaker`: SageMaker integrations

## Details
There might be several challenges to this, especially in serialization/deserialization for other platforms. The AWS formats are, on occasion, not very user friendly and internals are poorly documented.
However, my company is looking to use MLFlow with all of our ML clients and this feature would be a great selling point.
I'd love to contribute this feature on my free time with some guidance.
